definition: to be corrupted by the ways of the world (idiom)

sentences.english: It uses people's instinct and ignorant of science to try to blemish Soya Bean Salad Oil.
sentences.chinese: 是在利用人們的直覺和世俗感覺來抹黑大豆色拉油。

sentences.english: And she has a depth of intelligence in her eyes — worldly and soulful.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛裏有一種知性的深度，既世俗又空靈。

sentences.english: Worry so many senses, and not care secular reality.
sentences.chinese: 如此的多感善愁，毫不在意世俗。

sentences.english: Leisure culture is characteristic of both poetry and secularity.
sentences.chinese: 休閒文化具有詩性和世俗性雙重品格。

sentences.english: Do you believe in perpetual love in this secular world?
sentences.chinese: 在這個世俗的世界你還相信有天長地久的愛情嗎？

sentences.english: Live, pluck the roses of the world to-day.
sentences.chinese: 生活吧，趁今朝趕緊採下那世俗的玫瑰。

sentences.english: Why is it resistant to secularization?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼伊斯蘭教抵抗世俗化？

sentences.english: In Buddhism, this is called Conventional Truth.
Politics must become a purely worldly affair.
sentences.chinese: 政治必須成爲一個純粹的世俗事務。

sentences.english: Pity, because a Secularist could probably do a bang up job.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，世俗主義者可能出昏招。

sentences.english: She has no duty to earthly accuracy or verisimilitude.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有責任去確保世俗的精確和逼真。

sentences.english: Only the Atheist can be a consistent Secularist .
sentences.chinese: 只有無神論者可以一個一致的世俗。
我們的社會是個世俗社會。

sentences.english: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world
sentences.chinese: 我們爲孩童的時候，受管於世俗小學之下，也是如此。

sentences.english: The boundary between the modern art and the secular world is distinct and absolute.
sentences.chinese: 現代藝術與世俗之間的界線被劃分得相當清楚且絕對。

sentences.english: They are powers in the worldly state, but they are obstacles to Samadhi.
sentences.chinese: 在世俗狀態下他們是力量，但對於三昧它們是障礙。

definition: to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
